cardinfo.CI: Solanum - Big Eggplant Tree/Big Eggplant Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: Big Eggplant is an unarmed shrub or small tree, growing up to 4 m tall. Branched are covered with a dense soft, and the can be up to 20 cm in diameter. Leaves are ovate-elliptical, 10-20 cm long, 3.5-15 cm wide, margin slightly wavy, base rounded to wedge-shaped, tip pointed to long pointed. Flowers appear in clusters at the end of branches. Sepal cup is bellashaped, 5 mm long, with ovate sepals. Flowers are star-shaped, about 1.5 cm in diameter, white, anthers oblong, about 2 mm long, opening with apical pores, ovary densely velvety, style 4-6 mm long, hairless. Fruit is round, 8-12 mm in diameter, velvety, dull yellow when ripe. This plant was earlier believed to be S. verbascifolium, which is actually a different species from South America. Flowering: All year.

Common: Big eggplant, Mullein nightshade, China flowerleaf, Potato tree, Tobacco tree
Hindi: Akra, Ban tamakhu, बन तमाखू पेड़
Kannada: Kadusonde, Kallarthi, Savudangi, ಚೌಡಂಗಿ ಮರ
Malayalam: Chunta, Erichunta, Malanjunta
Marathi: Kutri
Odiya: Idari, Vidari
Sanskrit: Gandira, Pathi, Priyamkari, Idari, Vidari
Tamil: Sundai, Karimulli, Mulkathri, Mulkathari, சுண்டை மரம்
Telugu: Budama, Rasagadi, Pittu
